name: Chicken Stir Fry
description: Quick Asian-style chicken with colorful vegetables and savory sauce. Ready in 25 minutes.

instructions.instruction: Toss chicken strips with 1 tbsp soy sauce and cornstarch. Marinate 10 minutes.
Mix sauce: Remaining soy sauce, sesame oil, and chicken broth. Set aside.
Prep all vegetables and place in separate bowls.
instructions.tip: Stir fry is fast - everything must be ready.

instructions.instruction: Heat wok or large pan over very high heat. Wait until slightly smoking.
instructions.tip: High heat is the secret to stir fry.

instructions.instruction: Add half the oil. Add chicken in single layer, don't touch for 2 minutes.
Flip chicken, cook 1-2 more minutes. Remove to plate.
instructions.tip: Chicken can be slightly pink - it will cook again.

instructions.instruction: Add remaining oil. Add hard vegetables (broccoli, carrots) and stir fry 2 minutes.
Add peppers and mushrooms, cook 1 more minute.
instructions.tip: Vegetables should stay crisp - don't overcook.

instructions.instruction: Add garlic and ginger, stir fry 30 seconds.
Pour sauce over, stir fry 1 minute until sauce thickens and coats everything.
Remove from heat, sprinkle sesame seeds and green onions. Serve immediately.

tips: High heat and short cooking (wok hei) intensifies flavor.
Have everything prepped before starting - it goes fast.
Don't crowd the pan - cook in batches if needed.
Use low-sodium soy sauce for less salt.
storageInfo: Refrigerate 3 days. Reheat quickly in pan.
servingSuggestion: Serve over hot rice or noodles. Add sriracha or chili sauce for heat.
variations: Add teriyaki sauce for different flavor.
